title: Indian Rajesh Exports acquires Swiss Valvambi for USD400m
text:
(MENAFN) India's largest maker and exporter of gold, Rajesh Exports, said that it has acquired Swiss metal refining giant Valvambi in a deal valued at USD400 million, The Peninsula Qatar reported.

The Indian company said in a statement that it had been undeterred by a recent slump in world gold prices to a five-year-low as it announced the takeover in Mumbai. 

India vies with China as the world's largest purchaser of gold but sluggish demand, combined with a strong dollar, saw prices fall last week to their lowest level since February 2010.

"This deal will add to Rajesh Exports' earnings. Valcambi is a profitable, cash-surplus, well-run firm with no labour issues," the company's Chairman told reporters.
